results.title: Quilts of Understanding
results.creator_credit: Jenene Egan and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
In this story, Jenene tells of her life-long passion for all things craft. Recounting one of her proudest moments, she speaks about some patches that she created for a collaborative quilt-making project, which was exhibited at her Uniting Church and throughout regional Victoria.

This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and the Wellington Shire Council.
results.description:

results.title: Whatever happened to La Pérouse?
results.creator_credit: Peter Kiernan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In addition to being a cherished family home, La Pérouse in Heidelberg, Victoria, is a historic building with a rich history, full of opera singers, vaudeville stars, and driving lessons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Kiernan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Our Matt
results.creator_credit: Noel Withers, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Noel Withers is very proud of his son Matt. Born with Crouzon Syndrome, Matt suffered hearing loss, facial abnomalities and had to undergo numerous procedures to accommodate brain growth. Some operations were more successful than others, but Matt faced them all with a determination that inspired admiration in those around him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Withers, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Bunga our haven
results.creator_credit: Pam Enting, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Pam Enting and some 19 other families are part owners of what they call ‘Bunga Haven’. She tells the story of how this arrangement came to be, and of the environmental battles that were undertaken to save the lake.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pam Enting, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Getting off map 30
results.creator_credit: Anna Poletti, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For the fourteen years that Anna Poletti has lived in Melbourne, her various residences have had one thing in common - you can locate them all on map 30 of the Melways street directory. She pays homage to the streets and intersections of her neighbourhood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Poletti, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Forgotten corner
results.creator_credit: Samara McIlroy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘A little further up the road and a little further into the wilderness than you think.’ Samara McIlroy pays loving tribute to her special corner of Victoria, a place where you can still drop in for a ‘cuppa’ without ringing first.

results.creator_credit: Michelle Rayner, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Michelle Rayner reflects on the evolution of the marriage between Patricia and Michael, her parents. Throughout the years they have gone through many changes both personally and as a couple, and often reflecting the times.

results.title: Green Fingers: Indoor Plants
results.brief_description:
‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Indoor Plants’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to propagate and look after indoor plants.

The film contains wonderful footage of the glasshouses at Burnley Horticultural College, with plants shown including rubber plants, philodendron and rex begonias. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.
results.description:
Green Fingers was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Indoor Plants’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to propagate and look after indoor plants.

The film contains wonderful footage of the glasshouses at Burnley Horticultural College, with plants shown including rubber plants, philodendron and rex begonias. The episodes of Green Fingers are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of Sow What, Better Homes and Gardens, and Gardening Australia.
description_for_label:
Green Fingers was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Indoor Plants’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to propagate and look after indoor plants.

The film contains wonderful footage of the glasshouses at Burnley Horticultural College, with plants shown including rubber plants, philodendron and rex begonias. The episodes of Green Fingers are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of Sow What, Better Homes and Gardens, and Gardening Australia.
